channel.title: Mail error

item.title: Mail error
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:7, topic:288082”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=380881.msg2871873#msg2871873 date=1247817216]

Depends on what operating system you are running.

He is running WAMP on windows.

Many ISP block access to port 25, that can be the reason, check if it is open.

In the case of XAMPP on windows, it comes with a mail server, don’t know what WAMP is, but get XAMPP if you don’t have it.
[/quote]

WAMP is basically the same as XAMPP iirc, WAMP = Window apache mysql php

XAMPP has the same, just with phpmyadmin.[/quote]

XAMPP on windows also has a mail server installed and configured, which will solve the problem of the thread poster, which is why I suggested it in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Mail error
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:8, topic:288082”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=380881.msg2872118#msg2872118 date=1247840866]

Depends on what operating system you are running.

He is running WAMP on windows.

Many ISP block access to port 25, that can be the reason, check if it is open.

In the case of XAMPP on windows, it comes with a mail server, don’t know what WAMP is, but get XAMPP if you don’t have it.

WAMP is basically the same as XAMPP iirc, WAMP = Window apache mysql php

XAMPP has the same, just with phpmyadmin.
[/quote]
It does not have an Mail server.
Its is just as LAMP on Linux.[/quote]
This is true. For a mail server use postfix or similar.

Read full topic

@chrham2 wrote:

[quote=".Unlimited, post:2, topic:288082"]Well first things first, do you have a mail server up and running?

If you do make sure the settings are correct. (php.ini)[/quote]

How i make a mail server?

item.title: Mail error

item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

Well first things first, do you have a mail server up and running?

If you do make sure the settings are correct. (php.ini)

Read full topic

item.title: Mail error
item.dc:creator: @chrham2 chrham2
item.description:
@chrham2 wrote:

Warning: mail() [function.mail]: Failed to connect to mailserver at “smtp.isp.net” port 25, verify your “SMTP” and “smtp_port” setting in php.ini or use ini_set() in C:\wamp\www\test\index.php on line 9

How do I fix it?
Here is the code

<?php
$to      = 'example@example.exa';
$subject = 'Test';
$message = 'Hei';
$headers = 'From: Test@test.test' . "\r\n" .
    'DoNotReply' . "\r\n" .
    'X-Mailer: PHP/' . phpversion();

mail($to, $subject, $message, $headers);
?>

Read full topic
